CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 25, 1972, pg. 14 reads: "Giving Thanks - The beautiful oil painting in foreground was presented to Mrs. Willa Mae Rice, second from left, by members of the recently organized Christian Society in Hazelwood, which bears her name. The formal presentation was made by the artist, Mrs. Rita Jones, second from right, organizer and president of the group.  OThers in the picture, reading from left are, Lieut. Leo A. Anderson, brother of the honoree and featured speaker;  Timmy Johnson, master of ceremonies; Paul Holt, author of a poem dedicated to the occasion; Mrs. Faye McBride, Deacon Frank Jones and Deacon James Brantly, who gave remarks. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Lieut. Leo A. Anderson, Willa Mae Rice receiving painting from artist Rita Jones, Timmy Johnson, Paul Holt, Faye McBride, Deacon Frank Jones, and Deacon James Brantly, posed in interior
